channel.title: Disabling commands
channel.description:
How would I disable all commands in the duel arena
& also in just a certain area alone?
Thanks

item.title: Disabling commands
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

In PI there should be a boolean method in the Client or Player class…
Believe it’s called isInDuel() or inDuel() (You may have both and they may do different things. Look for the one that has the X and Y’s in if statements for the 4 arenas)

Create an if statement in your commands class (Before any commands) that checks if the boolean is true. If it’s true, I’d make the if statement send a message to the player and then return, as you don’t want the command to execute.

Read full topic

item.title: Disabling commands
item.dc:creator: @Welliton_inc Welliton_inc
item.description:
@Welliton_inc wrote:

Well then my example may work. Check to see if you have something like the “isinduel” or something similar. If you do, change accordingly and then it should work. You’d need to do that for every one of your commands though. There may be an easier way but i’m not too familiar with PI.

Read full topic

item.title: Disabling commands
item.dc:creator: @Gardenn Gardenn
item.description:
@Gardenn wrote:

[quote=“Welliton_inc, post:2, topic:551409”]Please provide more information. What base are you using?

An example:

if (command.startsWith("xxxx") && isInDuel == false) { teleportToX = xxx; teleportToY = yyy; heightLevel = 0; }

Just add the “isInDuel == false” at the end of each command. It may not work because you didn’t tell me the base you used. But this is just something to get you going I suppose.[/quote]

I am using a 317 PI

Read full topic

item.title: Disabling commands
item.dc:creator: @Welliton_inc Welliton_inc
item.description:
@Welliton_inc wrote:

Please provide more information. What base are you using?

An example:

if (command.startsWith("xxxx") && isInDuel == false) { teleportToX = xxx; teleportToY = yyy; heightLevel = 0; }

Just add the “isInDuel == false” at the end of each command. It may not work because you didn’t tell me the base you used. But this is just something to get you going I suppose.
